page.title: 12OLD FRIENDS FROM HORNCHURCH
page.content:
An interview with Mrs Dakin.
Mrs. Dakin has lived in the area for 37 years and was a teacher in Suttons Primary. She is very knowledgeable about the area. She told us that St. George's Hospital, which lies close to the school, was once a WORKHOUSE. The bungalows that border the school are all new and the wood-store that was close by disappeared years ago. Mrs. Dakin told us about the things that she enjoyed as a young woman. She would pay 2 old pennies to get into the cinema and often went to church where she talked and did some needlework. Jobs are harder to find today than when she was younger, but Mrs. Dakin much prefers today's fashions. Clothes are easier to look after and are much more attractive than they used to be. SUTTONS SCHOOL.
